resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
trxcllnt commented on pull request #4746: [ARROW-5741]: [JS] Make numeric vector from functions consistent with TypedArray.from
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4746
 
 
   This PR updates `IntVector.from()` and `FloatVector.from()` to use the new Builders to cast input values that don't exactly match the expected numeric type, per [this discussion](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/b648a781cba7f10d5a6072ff2e7dab6c03e2d1f12e359d9261891486@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E) on the mailing list.
   
   Previously, these methods behaved like `reinterpret_cast` in C++, but now they behave like numpy's `ndarray.astype()`. The new behavior of zero-copy vs. copied is:
   * If the input type is the same type as the Vector we want to create, the Vector is created zero-copy
   * If if the input type is different (or the input isn't a TypedArray), we use the Builders to enumerate the values, cast each one to the desired type, and construct a new Vector from the results.
   
   Closes [ARROW-5741](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5741)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

domoritz commented on pull request #4746: ARROW-5741: [JS] Make numeric vector from functions consistent with TypedArray.from
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4746#discussion_r304643554
 
 

 ##########
 File path: js/src/builder/float.ts
 ##########
 @@ -21,8 +21,30 @@ import { Float, Float16, Float32, Float64 } from '../type';
 /** @ignore */
 export class FloatBuilder<T extends Float = Float, TNull = any> extends FixedWidthBuilder<T, TNull> {}
 
+const minFloat16 = -1;
+const maxFloat16 = (65535 - 32767) / 32767;
 
 Review comment:
   Maybe extract all the magic numbers into constants. Like `32767`, `32767`, and `65536`.

trxcllnt commented on pull request #4746: ARROW-5741: [JS] Make numeric vector from functions consistent with TypedArray.from
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4746#discussion_r304668076
 
 

 ##########
 File path: js/src/builder/float.ts
 ##########
 @@ -21,8 +21,30 @@ import { Float, Float16, Float32, Float64 } from '../type';
 /** @ignore */
 export class FloatBuilder<T extends Float = Float, TNull = any> extends FixedWidthBuilder<T, TNull> {}
 
+const minFloat16 = -1;
+const maxFloat16 = (65535 - 32767) / 32767;
 
 Review comment:
   This is the magic formula to create a float16 from a uint32 (65535 is max half float aka 2^16-1, 32767 is 2^15-1). From what I understand of how this works, subtracting 2^15 from the target sets the lowest 15 bits to 0, then dividing by 2^15 is essentially a right shift 15 to mask off the remaining bits. We use this formula in other places like the get and set routines for the Float16 types as well.
